intro.description:
This cheat sheet will demonstrate how to define a feature based product configuration using a plug-in based one and create a feature for an RCP application using PDE.
To learn more about using cheat sheets, click the help button in the top right corner (?).

item.title: Open the plug-in development perspective
item.description:
To open the plug-in development perspective, select Window->Open Perspective->Other... and choose Plug-in Development.
Alternatively, click the following button to perform the task.

item.title: Open the product editor
item.description:
To open the product editor (if it is not already open), expand the com.example.rcpapp tree dialog in the Package Explorer view and double-click on the rcpapp.product file.
Alternatively, click the following button to perform the task.

item.title: Switch to a feature based product configuration
item.description:
Select the Overview tab to display the Overview page if it is not the initial page.
To switch to a feature based product configuration, select the features radio button under the Product Definition heading.
Select File->Save from the main menu.

item.title: Create the feature
item.description: To create the feature, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select the "Dependencies" tab to display the "Dependencies" page
Select the "New Feature..." tool button in the "Features" section.
Input "com.example.feature" into the "Project Name" text box on the "Feature Properties" page
Input "RCP Application Feature" into the "Feature Name" text box and click "Next >"
Select the "com.example.rcpapp" checkbox on the "Refererenced Plug-ins and Fragments" page and click "Finish"

item.title: Add a feature description and license agreement
item.description:
The com.example.rcpapp feature editor should be opened on the Overview page.
To add a feature description and license agreement, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select the "Information" tab
Input "RCP application feature description" into the "Text" text box within the "Feature Description" tab
Select the "License Agreement" tab within the "Information" page
Input "RCP application license agreement" into the "Text" text box
Select "File->Save" from the main menu

item.title: Add features to the product configuration
item.description: To add features to the product configuration, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select the "rcpapp.product" tab in the workbench to return back to the product editor (opened on the "Dependencies" page)
Click the "Add..." button under the "Features" heading
Select the "org.eclipse.rcp" feature within the "Feature Selection" dialog box and click "OK"
Select "File->Save" from the main menu

item.title: Export the feature based product
item.description: To export the feature based product, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select the "Overview" tab to display the "Overview" page
Click the "Eclipse Product export wizard" hyperlink under the "Exporting" heading to launch the "Export" dialog box
Verify that "/com.example.rcpapp/rcpapp.product" is entered in the "Configuration" combo box within the "Product Configuration" group
Input "rcpapp_feature-based" in the "Root directory" text box contained in the "Product Configuration" group
Input a destination directory in the "Directory" text box under the "Destination" group (e.g. "C:\" for Windows) and click "Finish"

item.title: Browse the exported feature based product directory
item.description: To browse the exported feature based product directory, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Navigate your file system to the destination directory specified in the previous step (e.g. "C:\" for Windows)
Note the presence of the "rcpapp_feature-based" directory in the destination directory and open it
Note the presence of the "com.example.rcpapp" plug-in along with other RCP plug-ins it depends upon within the "plugins" sub-directory
Note the presence of the "com.example.rcpapp" feature and "org.eclipse.rcp" feature within the "features" sub-directory
Note the "rcpapp" launcher with a branded icon ("rcpapp.exe" on Windows)
Run the "rcpapp" launcher
Observe the feature based RCP application you created that is fully executable outside the Eclipse workspace
